body.p:
Lexington,
Nov 7th 1864
Gov, Thos E Bramlette.

I have been appointed one of the judges of the election for tomorrow (Tuesday Nov 8th 1864) Very few men can be found willing to serve as judges of the election, I have been asked to serve, I have consented, I can not take the oath having served as second in the Steel & Blackburn duel Will you pardon me by telegraph if you can, As my friends are anxious I should serve,

Your true friend
W T Scott

Pardon
W. T. Scott
actg as second
7th Nov/64
